DataElement.preferredName: Intravenous Contrast Imaging Agent Administered Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The name of the intravenously administered compound that enables or improves the visualization of body structures or functions for medical imaging.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Into or within a vein. Intravenous usually refers to a way of giving a drug or other substance through a needle or tube inserted into a vein._Substances administered during imaging procedures that allows delineation of internal structures. Contrast agents appear opaque due to the difference in absorption of X-rays or other electromagnetic waves and surrounding tissue._A compound that enables or improves the visualization of body structures or functions for medical imaging._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (in-tra-VEE-nus) IV. Within a blood vessel.:Substances used in radiography that allow visualization of certain tissues.

Concepts.definition: Into or within a vein. Intravenous usually refers to a way of giving a drug or other substance through a needle or tube inserted into a vein.

Substances administered during imaging procedures that allows delineation of internal structures. Contrast agents appear opaque due to the difference in absorption of X-rays or other electromagnetic waves and surrounding tissue.

Property.preferredDefinition: A compound that enables or improves the visualization of body structures or functions for medical imaging.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: A compound that enables or improves the visualization of body structures or functions for medical imaging.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
